p: Coronaviruses possess a non-segmented positive-sense single-stranded RNA (ssRNA) genome of approximately 30 kb [ 42, 43]. It contains a 5′ end cap structure, replicase genes (rep 1a and rep 1b) coding for the non-structural proteins (nsPs) comprising two-thirds of the genome and the structural protein genes S (spike), E (envelope), M (membrane) and N (nucleocapsid) and various accessory genes interspersed within the structural genes at the 3′ end [ 2] ( Figure 1). Although the accessory proteins have been considered non-essential for replication, they play an important role in viral pathogenesis [ 43].
